Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: onebackwardglance
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Recamier for a week during the last week of January and early February. We picked the property because we love Place St. Sulpice and the area in general. If you like the wide blvds and the big stores over the river in the 1st or god forbid the 2nd, then you should stay at one of the big hotels over there. But if you prefer the Jardin du Luxembourg and the windy streets and beautiful walks and shops of the 6th and 5th, stay here. The hotel is perfect; we had one of the "tradition" rooms, which is slightly larger than their smallest, and has a separate toilet and shower. But not only is the general location wonderful--the specific is, in my opinion, the best in the area. Alighting on and returning to the square each time you leave or come back to the hotel is such a joy. If you love the organ at St. Sulpice, you can stop in multiple times per day to hear it. The fountain froze toward the end of our stay and was turned off, but the square is still always beautiful and spacious. The cafe across the way is perfect, always, for toast and espresso in the morning or a glass of wine late afternoon. The hotel staff were all extremely professional, personable and kind. Our room was deeply quiet and satisfying, with good sheets, towels, pillows and fantastic European hardware in the bathroom (shower only, but what a heavenly shower). The design of the hotel is elegant, not futzy and it is beautifully maintained. I hope that the property continues to maintain its high standards for staffing and upkeep. We hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Paris”
Reviews.Author: Langoustine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Recamier this summer, and i absolutely loved it. Design is desire, and Le Recamier is definetly a designer's hotel. Paris size, tiny, cozy, elegant, a la Parisienne, in the middle of St Germain, in the heart of the beautiful shopping streets. I always feel that staying in a big expensive hotels in Paris defeats the purpose of the city.here i felt secure, i felt at reach, and i was well serviced. I even laughed when i did my morning yoga stretching and my hands and my legs touched the table and the gueridon! The windows and the lighting coming through them inspire love or reading in bed. Then you have the beautiful tourists, the Italians and the spanish of this fashionable world of PARIS. Cafe de Flore is a walk away, so are many bars around. I will make of the Recamier my hotel of choice in Paris. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kallang
Reviews.Content: Pros (1) Stylish hotel: like a cover from Vogue (2) Great front desk: friendly and recommended great local restaurant to try (3) Free tea (4) Costy (5) Near Luxumborg gardens with amazing kid's playground (6) Very quiet as set back far away from street. Street is quiet as next to cathedral. (7) Nice neighbourhood Cons (1) Rooms are small. I got the biggest room. Could not fit spare bed in but only a crib. Conned my kid to sleep in the crib ("its your own castle") (2) Air con controls a bit wonky

Reviews.Title: “Price, Location and Service: Home Run!”
Reviews.Author: RugLord
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at 4 different hotels on the Left bank and, got to inspect all the rooms before we decided. Even the most expensive hotel, Relais Christine, was extremely disappointing, especially for the 520 Euro price tag. Hotel Recamier has the freshest, most updated rooms with crisp linens and comfortable rooms - we stayed in four different rooms on different floors and all were the same high quality. All the rooms are also very quiet. Vincent, the front desk manager, was extremely helpful in every instance and, the breakfast attendants were attentive and polite. Unless you eat alot of breakfast, the 18 Euro pricetag is a bit high. We would definitely stay at Recamier again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarinGlobal
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel-location, decor, staff. The hotel is located in a quiet corner of Place St Sulpice, right around the corner from many fashionable shops, bistros and restaurants. It was ideal for our weekend in Paris. Most hotel rooms in Paris are very small. This was also the case in this hotel. But the room was very well and nicely furnished, with a comfortable bed and a very beautiful bathroom, which is rare in Paris. It was lovely to rest in our room after exhausting sightseeing trips and the nights were blissfully quiet. The lobby/breakfast room is also a great place to rest and to have a coffee. The hotel offers free coffee+cake in the afternoon. A nice touch. We will certainly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: seasin1
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Hotel Therese, sister hotel to the Recamier, for about 10 years. I only heard through the staff about this new one, a four star, and thought to try it out for my next trip to Paris - I go very often so that was easy. I have liked everything about the hotel immediately, and for the same reasons I love the Therese. It's intimate, warmly decorated, though the Recamier is plusher (the beds are dreamy). The rooms are also more quiet and the location is wonderful, on the place St Sulpice, it makes me feel like I am on holiday even when I am not. The breakfast is nice, service is lovely, front desk is very accommodating with bookings for restaurant and the odd emergency (dentist). I can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Little jewel in St. Germain de Pres :>”
Reviews.Author: Shegotstyle
Reviews.Content: Quaint and comfortable rooms, service amazing especially front desk staff. Perfect location located in the hip area of St. Germain. Would definitely stay there again as shopping, restaurants and popular tourist landmarks are walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful haven st germain, near Luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: 1dales
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Clean, comfortable, great bed. Room 25 looked over the whisper quiet courtyard. After walking for miles each day it was wonderful to come back to this little haven. Although our room exceeded our budget, we made the right choice. Selene at the front desk was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location”
Reviews.Author: StratfordonAvonBob
Reviews.Content: Located in the corner of a very French square it is very well placed to wander around the streets of St. Germain. It is very compact - a narrow hallway with a tiny reception area where there is usually a helpful member of staff. Difficult place if you need to make a complaint though as everyone would hear. There is an atmospheric little lounge area and a tiny outside patio which has lovely ferns, greenery and a canopy. The room we had was a clubroom (largest category) which overlooks the square and has another window overlooking the side of the hotel. Very nicely furnished - classic with a twist - although could be a bit oppressive as it has v dark wallpaper. Great breakfast, but the service generally was a bit slow, which I suspect is because they have very few staff, who are extremely willing but not enough of them. Bedroom housekeeping was a bit hit and miss such as turndown one night but not the other and water left one day and not the other. Overall though a lovely little hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great decor and Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: travellingworldnow
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Recamier. The location is very nearby one of fashion designer Vanessa Bruno's boutiques, One of the best chocolateers in the world..Pierre Marcolini (raspberry heart are a must) and the famous stylish Candle shop Carrière Frères Industrie. The room was small and perfectly decorated. 'The views from our room's balcony were wonderful. Staff are very helpful with restaurant reservations and recommendations of local hotspots, bars and cafes. Great bathrooms with good showers. The complimentary afternoon tea with macaroons was a bonus This hotel is very stylish and boutique in its approach. You'll feel like you made a discovery, you'll want to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, best location!”
Reviews.Author: ony2
Reviews.Content: Small hotel on Place St Sulpice (some rooms have great views) well appointed rooms (not extremely big unless you choose a club room), nicely decorated, nice and helpful staff, excellent breakfast. A perfect hotel in St-Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielZu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly great. The locatio could not be better at least for what we wanted. The room seems to all have view on St Sulpice church, our had + a kind of samll balcony. Compared to other hotes in the 6th arrondissement this hotel is open with a nice view. Room amenities, bed qualoty, bathroom are excellent, really pleasant, Onlu the breakfast resaturant was too small we preferd to have breakfast out. For 1 to 2 nights is perfect Location + amazing bed, nice services

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk, to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Sydney4
Reviews.Content: After doing exhaustive research on Paris hotels, I came across glowing reviews of this hotel on some interior design blogs. I can now see why. The lobby lounge, while very small, is impeccably decorated. Loved just sitting and soaking up all the design details down to the door fixtures they used. Yes, the rooms are small as previously noted, but I'd much rather be in a small, exquisite room than a gigantic boring one. Breakfast is served to all guests each morning either outside on the terrace or indoors. Delicious pain au chocolat, cappuchino, teas, croissants. Terrific staff -- had my clothes ironed in about 15 minutes flat and brought fresh cherries to our room the first night. Cheerfully made and changed restaurant reservations for us repeatedly. This hotel is probably destined for a Rick Steves guidebook someday, so go now while you can still treasure it as your own "insider" find!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: swissbunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a couple of times before it was renovated, when it was *much* cheaper, but for the sake of proper research we decided to give a try after the renovation - and I have to say, we werent disappointed! The hotel has an absolutely wonderful location - a 30 second walk from the nearest Metro and some amazing restaurants also very near by. I've only ever stayed in a front-facing room which looks out on to St Sulpice church which is beautiful. The rooms have been brilliantly decorated, even if they are a bit on the small side. Very comfy beds, effective blackout curtains, iPod dock, tasefully decorated bathroom, and lovely floor to ceiling windows which give a view of the Eiffel tower. Friendly staff. Gorgeous! Unfortunately, we have to find other places to stay in Paris now as the price is pretty steep... but as soon as the boyfriend gets some better paid work, we'll be returning!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, quiet, good location, expensive”
Reviews.Author: heloiseandtom
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe room which was very small but had a nice view of the square outside, there was a compact bathroom with shower and the toiletries and linens were of a high standard. The room was nicely decorated but could be improved by taking out some of the excess furniture eg lamps. I got sick of having to dodge furniture, cupboard doors etc and I weigh 50 kgs, larger people would have problems moving around this room. It was very quiet at night except for the shower(?) noise from other rooms. In the lobby there was a computer with internet access which was great for quickly checking emails. I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, the area is full of amazing patisseries. The location is wonderful if you want to stay in St Germain but away from the noise which partly explains the high room rates. This hotel is best for people who have already seen the sights and just want to immerse themselves in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: peejay_london
Reviews.Content: Directly next door to the church of Saint-Sulpice in the Latin Quarter, the Hotel Recamier is a beautiful small hotel located just off the square. The rooms are stylishly designed and well appointed. The rooms are not large but are incredibly comfortable: spotlessly clean, nice bed and sizable bathroom. The location is excellent if you want to spend time around Saint-Germain, and it is closely located to the Jardin du Luxembourg, which is beautiful. The hotel has a really charming ground floor sitting room, which doubles as a breakfast room, and a small courtyard which is a nice place to have coffee in the afternoon. Free wi-fi is a bonus too. The staff were very helpful in making recommendations and bookings for dinner. Overall, probably a bit pricey but a lovely hotel in a great location and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: leiceterboy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the rooms are very well furnished and suprisingly roomy (for a Paris hotel). I had a bath in my room that was lovely and deep with a plethora of toileteries. The location is fantastic for the Luxembourg Gardens and St Germain. I am a very sensitive sleeper however and found the air conditioning in the rooms a bit noisy, even when turned off. To be fair however I was suffering from some stomach pains due to some ill advised food so that could have coloured my view somewhat. I would say that the rooms were a little pricey at €255 a night but maybe that is the going rate in Paris now. Overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Quiet- Clean for Parisian standards”
Reviews.Author: flowerchat1
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in Paris. I was expecting an even smaller room prior to arrival. The design is solid, if you're a fan of the firmdale hotels, this will make you feel comfortable. High quality linens, good beds, well designed, with a separate toilet and shower/bathroom. No space has been waisted here. However, a few important things that should be expected from a hotel that calls it 4 star; 1.The shelve in the bathroom was falling apart. Things would slide down as soon as you put something on it. Hello maintenance, have you not noticed this?For how long? 2. The window frame was borken 3. The gym is non existant. There is a broken bike and some kind of weight machine from who knows some garage. It was pouring down with rain during my stay so it wasn't very welcoming to go jogging in the otherwise beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg. I can't believe I would be the only one to have an issue with the gym. Finally, the price is very high. I got a great rate through ebookers, but if I had to pay the real rate, I simply wouldn't like to afford it. Hotel Recamier is very clean, for a city that has questionable hygiene standards in general.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic whimsical chic interior design”
Reviews.Author: vem28
Reviews.Content: Quiet elegant boutique hotel hidden away in a quiet corner of Place de St. Sulpice on the left bank in Paris. Romantic whimsical interior design with charming common areas for breakfast and complimentary afternoon tea. The setting felt like a piece of modern art a la Picasso era. Very clean tiny rooms, nice amenities. A bit of a schlep to tourist sites on the right bank but a fine location if you prefer the left bank and need a refuge from noise and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oliviaava08
Reviews.Content: We booked a 10-night stay at the Hotel Recamier for our party of 4 in October and the hotel exceeded our expectations in all categories. Prior to our arrival, we e-mailed the staff requests for airport transportation to and fro, and for multiple restaurant reservations. They could not have been more accomodating, making all reservations as requested. Throughout our stay, the staff handled changes to our reservations efficiently and cheerfully, and were extremely helpful in making suggestions as to local venues, directions and transportation. The hotel location next to L'Eglise St-Sulpice was central to many sites and allowed for a quiet nights sleep (no street noise). While the room was small (not unusual for Paris), it was extremely clean and the bed and linens were comfortable and spotless. The room had its own temperature control, so no issues with overheated rooms! The european-style breakfasts (coffee, tea, breads, jam, croissants, cheeses, ham, and cereals) were delicious and sustained us until late afternoon. This was our third trip to Paris, and when we return next year, we will stay at the Hotel Recamier. A most pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “Madame Silvie and staff save the day!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideParislover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here October 20 - 24, 2010 , after having our original accommodation in Paris cancelled at the last minute during the strikes . The hotel staff were fantastic in ensuring that we could indeed stay for the 4 nights despite the busyness of Paris and the strikes at the time. Madame Silvie was not only a picture of parisian chic but a most fantastic host and she was wonderfully supported by a terrific staff. Rooms were spotless and breakfasts and afternoon teas. were terrific . At their recommendations we had some very good dining experiences. The location was very central and within walking distance of all that we wanted to do. Without a doubt we would stay at Recamier again

Reviews.Title: “The most unaccommodating staff - will never book here again!”
Reviews.Author: elizabennett8
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were due to visit Paris right at the height of the protests. Because of the news we'd been hearing (travelers without taxis to take them to/from the airports, insanely crowded metro stations, and worse - potentially violent demonstrations), we were hesitant about coming on the date we had set, and asked Hotel Recamier for a little leeway to make up our minds about when to come. We did not intend to cancel our trip, merely to postpone our check-in date. We had asked for them to give us until the night before our intended arrival to let them know about whether we were going to postpone or not (most hotels will allow 24hours notice without penalty) - and we were flat-out refused. Admittedly, giving them less than a day's notice would be pushing it, but we were open to a little negotiation - perhaps the day before. Amidst all the chaos, we had thought that they would at least give us a little slack, but they were unbending and insisted on charging us a penalty (one night's stay) for informing them less than 3 days before our intended arrival (as per their policy). In the end, rather than pay for an extra night that we didn't stay for, we decided to cancel the trip altogether. If they were a little more accommodating, we would have at least gone for the week (we were originally going to stay 9 days!), but because they were so insistent on charging us the penalty, we decided not to give them our business. They might have charged me one night's stay now as a penalty, but if they had been a little more flexible, they'd have earned the income of at least a 5 night stay instead. Too bad, too - I was looking forward to staying with them, and now I will never book at Hotel Recamier again for any future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MCL73
Reviews.Content: The location of Recamier is truly amazing. Close to so many wonderful spots yet quiet and peaceful. I traveled solo and stayed in a luxury room on the second floor. At no point did outside noise disturb me and I kept the french windows overlooking the square open most of the time. Despite recent renovation, the hotel shows some wear but location and afternoon tea and overall charm make Recamier hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms -- delightful space”
Reviews.Author: NormD
Reviews.Content: The room was a tad on the small size but never the less delightful. The staff were very friendly and made us feel at home. The next time we visit Paris we will stay here again. Oh, and yes, very good Internet service -- and at no charge!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect piece of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 80percent
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It made our stay in Paris perfect. We spent many hours seeking the right hotel in Paris on sites including Trip Advisor and the like. So many looked good until you read the guest reviews and saw the guest photos. Many hotels have the odd good room that they include on their website, and the rest are tired, pokey and depressing. Not so at Hotel Recamier. Refurbished in 2009, every room was beautifully decorated and a pleasure to be in. The continental breakfast was simple but fabulous. (The specialist butter they offered with the baguette was sublime.) The location is perfect - overlooking Eglise St Sulpice. It is in a quiet corner of the square and all the windows are double glazed. So you will sleep uninterrupted and in comfort. Couldn't recommend it highly enough. St Sulpice is a very central part of the left bank.

Reviews.Title: “We'll always have Paris... Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: ERTB
Reviews.Content: The room, the style, the flair, the staff, the location, OMG, the location, all of it was a delight. Right on the border of the 6th and the 5th, the neighborhood is brilliant, simply brilliant. Seriously, as close to a perfect Paris experience as I could imagine, even with the Saint-Sulpice rehab going on. Even the price was within reason, considering the decor, the ambiance, the location and reality of Paris prices. Compared to 500 Euros a night at the Hilton, the Recamier is a bargain. It was our second trip to Paris; we stayed in 7th last time, just off Rue Rick. Loved that too, but we'll be going back to Recamier again, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: katiesueNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Recamier for our "Babymoon" and had such a fabulous experience. From the moment we walked in we knew we would be absolutely taken care of. Everyone who worked at the hotel was beyond friendly and helpful (and they all spoke English extremely well). Our Club Room was lovely; beautiful decor with windows that opened to a view of the little square below. Being six months pregnant, I needed to relax at the hotel in the afternoons after sightseeing all morning. Going back to the hotel to put my feet up was so peaceful. Our room was extremely quiet, and the ambiance was very tranquil. The complimentary teatime from 4-6pm was such a nice treat. Perhaps the most impressive part of our stay was how well I was looked after when my husband had to leave for business on our fourth day there. I stayed on by myself for two more nights, and the hotel front desk team watched over me like you wouldn't believe. I felt so safe and taken care of. On my last morning, as I was preparing for my 7am taxi to head to the airport, the gentleman at the front desk not only ran upstairs to carry my bags for me, but he also make me a coffee and asked me to wait in the lounge while he waited for the taxi. When the taxi arrived, he loaded my bags in the car, and then ran back to inform me that the taxi was ready and escorted me to the car. That's what I call first class service. We will very definitely return to the Hotel Recamier. Hopefully sooner rather than later!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tracywade
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 spectacular nights in this Hotel. It's in the popular 6th arrondissement, across the street from St Sulpice Church. The service was excellent, the staff was very helpful and smiled politely as I tried my French! The rooms are small, but that's the case in Paris. The air conditioning and free wifi made up for that. The hotel has recently undergone a major renovation and the decor is amazing. Very modern, but still comfortable. I will stay there if I'm ever in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Recamier for two nights in July and were incredibly happy with our choice. Having stayed at a number of different hotels in Paris, this is the first one that I would happily return to. The rooms are lovely with lots of amenities (including an ipod docking station), wonderful sheets and pillows and a very comfortable bed. The hotel is very well-located in the heart of St. Germain but it was also very quiet and we slept very well. We were on the top floor in one of the larger rooms (which I highly recommend). The bathroom was lovely too. I would recommend the buffet breakfast with the croissants, pain au chocolat, cafe au lait, fruit, yogurt and cereal. We can't wait to return!!! Our stay was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Private Oasis”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a leafy and quiet corner of St Sulpice Place you will find the perfect little upscale hotel. With only twenty four rooms, four to each floor, the hotel barely feels like a hotel, more like a private club. There is a single reception desk tucked away just inside the entry. Down a short hallway is a stylized lounge room with French doors that open to a small inner courtyard covered patio. The overall look is modern, yet elegant. These areas are used for breakfast, and the afternoon complementary coffee and cake. There is also a computer available here for guests to use. We stayed in a club room which was decent in size and well appointed. It had a view of St. Sulpice through the front French doors. What was nice about this room was that there was a second set of French doors overlooking the small inner courtyard, and a third set in the bathroom. The room was stylish and comfortable with good use of fabrics and earth tones. In addition to a desk with chair, there was a separate comfortable leather chair and table. The large closet area in the entry corridor provided a good amount of storage space. There was also a refrigerator in the closet area that had room for a few personal items such as water bottles. The bathroom was a good size with a large tub/shower combination. Although the club rooms cost a fair amount of money more then other rooms, we felt it was well worth it, especially since some other reviews have stated that the rooms in the hotel are small. There is a cool looking staircase that is open to the room corridors and runs the full height of the building. On each floor is a shelve in the staircase with very interesting and bold pieces of art that helps make you feel like you are staying in a unique and special place. Because the hotel is so small, the staff level is also a little limited. We think some staff members perform multiple tasks. This was not a problem for us, but this is not the type of hotel where lots of staff are running around all over the place. However, if you need them, they are there to help, and are very nice. The hotel is located near vibrant areas of the city, and metro stops are nearby. Perhaps the best advantage of this hotel is that it has been recently totally renovated and it shows. Everything looks very new, upscale, and fresh. We have stayed at several hotels in Paris and this is our new favorite and we will be back. We really were impressed with the condition, style, and location of the hotel. These factors all combined to make this property a very smart choice for a stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Exercise care in booking on line”
Reviews.Author: Timetraveller16
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on-line - admittedly after cancelling but then rebooking and getting email confirmation. When I arrived - after a very long flight - no sign of the booking. Although I was able to stay one night and an effort was made - in a rather desultory way - to find another hotel - the assumption was that it was my fault, until I provided details of the on line confirmation the next day. Although they finally admitted responsibility - it was a poor introduction to a hotel which promised so much. The room itself was fine - nice views over Saint Sulpice and a great bathroom and effective air conditioning. Despite a recent renovation the room was showing signs of wear - lights not functioning. The lounge area was pleasant - quiet, cool and jasmine in flower. Not much of a hotel to stay in for business purposes. WIFI reception was poor and inconsistent. Access to a printer in the lounge was OK. After staying in 4 hotels of 4 star standard in the area in the last year - this one rates behind Villa Madame (great value, stylish and quiet) and the Luxembourg Parc (more expensive but very comfortable and right on Luxembourg Gardens). Each of these hotels was a seamless experience with great staff (the HLP providing accommodation for the rest of the time in Paris with care, concern and style)!

Reviews.Title: “Jewel”
Reviews.Author: rkr727
Reviews.Content: We successfully changed to this hotel when returning to Paris after several weeks traveling through France. The first part of the journey we stayed around the corner in a ridiculously small room. Albeit, the competition is nice and offers an afternoon snack with cocktails, this hotel, cannot be beaten for its value. The common rooms are tiny, so don't expect to come in and put your feet up. The "exercise" room is a joke. The location, solitude, chic factor, comfort and willingness of the staff to help with anything you need, however, is a great asset to this establishment. The club room, based on the previous poster's comments, is the room to book. It is spacious, quiet and has a beautiful outlook to the tree lined square. We love the neighborhood and there is a great array of restaurants around beyond earshot. We did not try room service or breakfasts but the bellman was precious in his efforts to help and the concierge sent us to great restaurants where the locals go...would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: halfrench
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful and attentive. The rooms were small but well designed and very comfortable. I loved the location. We walked to the Luxembourg Gardens and fine restaurants in the heart of Saint Germain des Près. My husband will use Hotel Recamier for business too since he enjoyed our stay so much.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, pity about the ridiculously small room”
Reviews.Author: Chicklet39
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was an enjoyable stay at Hotel Recamier. The location is excellent – just a stone’s throw away from St Germain and St Sulpice. The decor is sleek and subtle in a Wallpaper-ish way. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, and the WIFI worked without fail. There were also some nice touches including tea with some light snacks every afternoon, and newspapers in the lobby. Now, the downside: The rooms are ridiculously small for what you pay (£210 in our case). I have travelled throughout Europe and stayed in far humbler quarters, but I have to say at these rates I could not help feeling slightly ripped off. I am a vertically-challenged Asian, and even I felt claustrophobic! It was so cramped that to open my suitcase while being to reach for things in the cupboard, I had to open the cupboard door, stick a chair between it and the bed, then place my suitcase on top and open it such that one end is ON THE BED (see photo to believe). Needless to say, opening the other suitcase at the same time was out of the question! Also, despite staying three nights basic amenities were somewhat lacking, e.g. there was only one cup in the bathroom, and no drinking glasses. When we returned to Paris a few days later, these were in our room. Rather inconsistent... I would definitely stay in the area on my next trip, but I am not sure I would return to Recamier at the current rates because of the room size. If the hotel offered more appealing rates, I would definitely be more inclined.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: cecilnyc
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky traveler with high standards for accommodations...everything about this hotel - decor, service, attention to detail, location, quality of amenities, facilities, etc. was perfect. It's simply elegant, cozy, well thought out, chic and warm...can't recommend it enough. I would come back to Paris just to stay here again...almost don't want anyone else to find out about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved EVERYTHING about this HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yusra_M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Recamier while being in Paris for a quick weekend trip, from the time i checked in till the moment i checked out, **Even allowed me to check into the hotel room prior to my check in time**-- Amazingly friendly and attentive staff & service! Hotel speaks for it self, Perfect Location--tucked away in the Saint Germain area, 6th er. quite central, Modern art deco decor! Extremely comfortable!! Had forgotten my adapter for my laptop charger, and they had one! --needed some stamps for mailing out a few Postcards, and they took care of it.. Loved The receptionist, super attentive and friendly, both the am and overnight night staff.. Making sure i had everything i needed and that i had a pleasurable stay, which it was! Would definitely go Back and stay there if ever in Paris again!!! :-)
